message:
I've started looking at parts to build a PC.  I just want to know a few things:

1.  How important is a motherboard for gaming?  Could I get by with $100 one or should I spend a bit more?

2. What is the difference between AMD and Intel processors.  I noticed that AMD is quite a bit cheaper.  Do they not preform as well?
For motherboard, don't get too cheap or too expensive one. $100 ~ $150 should be good.
for CPU, you get what you pay, I recommend intel i5 2500k atm.

recommended spec : CPU : core i5 2500k, motherboard Asus P8P67-M (I like m-ATX), GPU : ATI HD 6950 reference (you can tweak it to make it works just like 6970) , Ram : ddr3 1600 2* 2GB, HDD, case, PSU you like, it would be about $800 :p I sent you the newegg cart
So you recommend Radeon over GeForce?
Also that graphics card used PCI 2.1, can that be put in a PCI 2.0 motherboard or would I have to find a 2.1 motherboard or 2.0 graphics card?

it will work fine with pci2.0 board, don't worry. I recommend HD 6950 atm because it is actually HD 6970. There are $100 difference between them, so it's a pretty good deal. You just need to download 6970 bios and put it on your 6950, then it will work just like 6970 :p here is the article about it http://www.techpowerup.com/articles/overclocking/vidcard/159 you can get nvidia if you prefer them, they are great as well.
